response: Koine Greek is a common form of Greek that was spoken and written during the Hellenistic period, roughly from the 4th century BC to the 4th century AD. It evolved from Attic Greek and became the lingua franca of the Mediterranean world under the Macedonian and Roman empires. Koine is particularly significant because it is the language in which the Septuagint (the Greek translation of the Hebrew Bible) and the New Testament were written. It bridges classical Greek and modern Greek, incorporating elements from various Greek dialects and showing some influence from other languages due to the wide geographic spread of its use. In the context of your project, "koine" refers to this historical language used for educational storytelling.
